published_attributes.title: Welcome aboard! 👋
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Hello fellow Netgural! With this short course we want to show you around Netguru culture, so you can have a smooth start 🙌

The most crucial info has been presented during the onboarding session already, but we prepared this 'wrap up' of our culture and customs, so you can feel more at home from the day 1.

Let's start! 🚀

blocks.text: Hello fellow Netgural! With this short course we want to show you around Netguru culture, so you can have a smooth start 🙌
The most crucial info has been presented during the onboarding session already, but we prepared this 'wrap up' of our culture and customs, so you can feel more at home from the day 1.
Let's start! 🚀

published_attributes.title: Values & Code of Conduct
published_attributes.serialized_body:
To start properly, let's just quickly go through two most important Community guidelines: our code of conduct and values.

Code of conduct

It's a set of rules that we want all of Netgurals to follow and it's based on respect to one another. Its goal is to make our work environment safe and friendly 🕊

  1. Be respectful to those with opposing views.
  2. Strive to ensure that your language and actions are free of personal disparaging remarks.
  3. When interpreting the words and actions of others, always assume good intentions.
  4. Do your best to avoid/counteract inequities/bias in your everyday thinking and actions
  5. Behaviour which can be reasonably considered harassment will not be tolerated.

Values

We've got 7 values, which, hopefully, will help you to get out of your comfort zone and will help you make everyday decisions at work:

  1. Exceed clients’ and colleagues’ expectations.
  2. Take ownership and question the status quo in a constructive manner.
  3. Be brave, curious and experiment – learn from all successes and failures.
  4. Act in a way that makes all of us proud.
  5. Build an inclusive, transparent and socially responsible culture.
  6. Be ambitious and grow yourself and the people around you.
  7. Recognise excellence and engagement.

Escalation Path

In case you encounter any problems in your daily work (ethical, project related or others), were always here to help you. Please have a look out our escalation path and don't hesitate to contact a dedicated person.

published_attributes.title: Slack - our virtual community space
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You already know Slack and it's our main communication tool but I'm not sure you know how you can move around it and what great places it can take you to 🤔 Let's go through the most important facts about our Netguru Slack.

  1. Our main channel is #ng-team and you'll find all people from Netguru there. In this channel you'll find a lot of important announcements, reminders and calls to action, as well as welcoming new joiners, morning greetings, kudoses and some joking around.

published_attributes.title: Slack - our virtual community space
published_attributes.serialized_body:
2. There are maaaany channels which are not related to any projects but they are also parts of our community. You can visit #dogs channel if you're a fan of those mighty creatures; you can go to #sustainability if you are interested in sustainability-related topics; you can go to #moto if you want to chat about cars. There's really a lot to pick from 🤯

Here's a list of our useful/fun Slack channels - hope you'll find a place that you like! 🕺

(but trust me, #dogs are really cool)

However, in case you don't find any channel that's suitable for you, you can always create a new one and invite people in, eg. by promoting your channel on #ng-team ☝️

published_attributes.title: Slack - our virtual community space
published_attributes.serialized_body:
3. We love custom emojis and situation jokes. There might be moments (especially in your first weeks) when you'll be wondering what does "dziobak" mean, who is Hulio Matyska or why people are fighting over Kielecki and Winiary mayonnaise 🤯

To make your life easier, let me introduce to you our "Netguru's Cultural Heritage" cycle where you'll find all the answers. There are 3 parts and it's a total must-read:

  • emojis - stories behind our most famous custom emojis,
  • people - VIPs you need to check out (and it's not about the Core team),
  • phenomena - fantastic events that happen/take place still from time to time, which seem confusing at first.
Hope you like it and if there's anything else you need explanation on - let us (Community Team) know! ☝️

published_attributes.title: Slack tips for beginners
published_attributes.serialized_body:
If Slack is a new tool for you, here's a few tips that will help you start off.

1. Update your profile: your preferred name, job position, leader, location (and more additional info if you want to), so it looks like this:

2. Communicate your availability by updating your status

3. Use additional options and integrations that Slack offers (like Polly for polls or creating a custom emoji)

You'll learn more on how to deal with Slack during your Netguru Way session about Remote Work - stay tuned! 🙌

published_attributes.title: Communication is key!
published_attributes.serialized_body:
... especially in these remote times ;) Everybody's different (duh!) and has a specific style of communication. Yet, no matter where you are and who you're talking to, here's a few universal principles that will make your communication easier.

  1. Be polite and respectful, always.
  2. Assume good intentions ✌️ - there are situations when some Slack message might sound ambiguous or even harsh (like when there are no emojis added - there's something wrong for sure!) - do not rush into judgement ☝️ try assuming your conversation partner had good intentions and simply ask for more context or tell him/her how it sounded for you (depending on the situation).
  3. Use mentions wisely, eg. @channel, @here, @everyone or @some_team. If you abuse those, it will, most probably, backfire on you 😅
  4. Don't send “empty” messages - they have no real information and leave people hanging. You know the ones I am talking about: “you there?”or “hey” that is followed by stone-cold silence (while your co-worker waits for your reply).
This set of tips is just a starter - please read our guidelines for effective collaboration to get more comprehensive knowledge 😉

This set of tips is just a starter - please read our guidelines for effective collaboration to get more comprehensive knowledge 😉

published_attributes.title: Netguru Glossary
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Now, let me introduce you to our most used acronyms, names and phrases that altogether create our unique Netguru Glossary. These might be helpful for you to understand what's going on around you in your first weeks in particular.

I guess you will have some moments like this:

... but I'm sure you'll be using those terms fluently very soon. Let me help you 😀

Acronyms

  • AAR - After Action Review, it’s a meeting where you reflect on a project or a process and analyse what went well, what could’ve gone better and how it can be improved.
  • AMA - Ask Me Anything; it’s a live session with the Core team where they address questions from Netguru employees; it usually takes place every month (via Zoom)
  • BV - Business Value; it’s the continuous impact on the stakeholders, business and its environment, created by delivering key factors of success in a project, product or at an account level
  • CTA - most commonly used as an acronym meaning Call to Action but it’s also the name of our travel external agency (Corporate Travel Assistant)
  • CWR - Call When Ready
  • EBITDA - Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization; it’s a measure of a company's overall financial performance and is used as an alternative to net income in some circumstances
  • F2F - Face to Face; it’s an evaluation meeting with your leader, where you summarize the last quarter, discuss your goals and share feedback (which happens once per 3 months)
  • NDA -Non Disclosure Agreement; a contract that includes confidential information that the parties wish to share with one another for certain purposes, but wish to restrict access to
  • OKRs - Objectives and Key Results; it’s a collaborative goal-setting tool used by teams (while planning each quarter) to set goals with measurable results
  • O3 - One on One meeting with your leader, usually happens once per week
  • PDS - an acronym for Product Design Sprint; methodology that helps to follow a path from idea to execution of features or whole products in a manner that fits User needs

published_attributes.title: Netguru Glossary
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Other names & phrases

  • B-Corp - certificate for businesses that meet the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability to balance profit and purpose (more info on the B-Corp official website & on our Confluence)
  • Burning Minds - our annual internal tech conference, either online or connected with an all-company integration; 
  • Bob the bot - simply it’s a bot called “Bob”, available on Slack, that can make your life easier by e.g. showing people available on the bench or remind you about tracking your working time (more info on Bob here)
  • Core Team - people leading Netguru - chiefs & heads of departments
  • Dinner - a meeting that does not necessarily imply dinner with food, rather a meeting after work organized by Netguru with your team/project team/whole company
  • Donut - a bot on Slack that pairs you with random person so you can have a virtual chat/coffee/lunch together; available on #donut-chat channel
  • Head - a person leading the wholedepartment
  • Iteration - a new version of a piece of software/process/project
  • Kudos - props, saying ‘thank you’, mostly on #ng-team on Slack via Kudos app. To use it, go on #ng-team just type “/kudos” + mention a particular person/people + write what you’d like to thank them for
  • Lunching - to be exact, lunching.pl; an app that allows you to order lunc. It’s kind of Uber Eats for corporations, which allows you to order food to our offices/to your private address 
  • Netgural - a person who works at Netguru, Netgurals in plural 
  • Netguru After Hours - webinar series dedicated to people’s experiences, hobbies and passions 
  • Ng-team - our main Slack channel where everyone from Netguru is present
  • Ping - reminder, notification; reaching out to someone again, you can ‘ping someone’
  • Reve - short for revenue; income received by an organization in the form of cash or cash equivalents
  • Togglować /to toggle - to track working time with the Toggl app 
  • Workation - working and being on vacation combined (away from home)

blocks.text: Other names & phrases

B-Corp - certificate for businesses that meet the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability to balance profit and purpose (more info on the B-Corp official website & on our Confluence)
Burning Minds - our annual internal tech conference, either online or connected with an all-company integration;

Bob the bot - simply it’s a bot called “Bob”, available on Slack, that can make your life easier by e.g. showing people available on the bench or remind you about tracking your working time (more info on Bob here)
Core Team - people leading Netguru - chiefs & heads of departments
Dinner - a meeting that does not necessarily imply dinner with food, rather a meeting after work organized by Netguru with your team/project team/whole company
Donut - a bot on Slack that pairs you with random person so you can have a virtual chat/coffee/lunch together; available on #donut-chat channel
Head - a person leading the wholedepartment
Iteration - a new version of a piece of software/process/project

Kudos - props, saying ‘thank you’, mostly on #ng-team on Slack via Kudos app. To use it, go on #ng-team just type “/kudos” + mention a particular person/people + write what you’d like to thank them for
Lunching - to be exact, lunching.pl; an app that allows you to order lunc. It’s kind of Uber Eats for corporations, which allows you to order food to our offices/to your private address
Netgural - a person who works at Netguru, Netgurals in plural
Netguru After Hours - webinar series dedicated to people’s experiences, hobbies and passions
Ng-team - our main Slack channel where everyone from Netguru is present
Ping - reminder, notification; reaching out to someone again, you can ‘ping someone’
Reve - short for revenue; income received by an organization in the form of cash or cash equivalents
Togglować /to toggle - to track working time with the Toggl app
Workation - working and being on vacation combined (away from home)

published_attributes.title: Netguru Glossary
published_attributes.serialized_body:
What can you hear often

  • Can you see my screen? - a classic question to ask by the presenter on a call while he/she’s screensharing
  • Jesteś zmutowany/a / You’re muted - pretty self explanatory :D you can hear it during a call when someone’s microphone is turned off
  • Masz kredki? / Do you have the credentials? - kredki/credentials are simply login and password needed to 
  • Nie mam spejsu / I have no space - someone can say that when he/she’s not able to do something because of the workload
Are there any other words or acronyms that surprised you? Let us know!☝️

published_attributes.title: Remote community
published_attributes.serialized_body:
We know working remotely is not that easy sometimes and many of us miss meeting people casually in the office, so we want you to be a part of our remote community 👾

Remote Community building

To help stay connected with your colleagues at Netguru, we've gathered a bunch of activities, ideas and tips regarding our remote community page on Confluence. Here's what you can find there:

  • integration & fun - info and ideas on:
    • games
    • Donut meetings
    • our virtual Ng Kitchen
    • Netguru After Hours webinars
  • wellbeing - resources regarding:
    • excercise initiatives
    • wellbeing webinars
    • remote work tips
  • ideas & materials for parents - list of articles, webinars, games and other resources gathered mostly from our #parents channel on Slack

Online events and initiatives

But that's not the end! There are many online initiatives and events that we're running throughout the whole year. Some are conducted regularly - like our Burning Minds conference, some are happening occasionally (like webinars, competitions, challenges or tournaments).

We always announce our events & initiatives on #ng-team on Slack, so I don't think you will miss it! 😅 And if you want to catch up with what's been going on before you joined, you can have a look at:

  • all Netguru photos & videos
    • Burning Minds 2020
    • Xmas Hangout 2020 (including mulled wine making with Robert Makłowicz 🍷)
  • webinars recordings
💡If you have an idea for an event/initiative or there's a game/challenge you'd like to suggest - let us know!

published_attributes.title: Thanks!
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Thanks a lot for going through this course! I hope you enjoyed it and that you'll also have a good time exploring our culture further 😀 

If you'd like to share your feedback, please reach out to us on Slack: @migacz_solutions or @iga or leave it via this form :)

Take care and see you around! 🙌
